intro: Cupania sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran cupania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the Indonesian island of Sumatra and thrives in tropical rainforest environments. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. Cupania sumatrana is often found in moist, shaded areas and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
